Eugene Kuleshov wrote:

>   Ops. It is actually free chapter on JUnut from O'Reilly's "Java
> Extreme Programming Cookbook".
>   http://www.oreilly.com/catalog/jextprockbk/index.html
>   http://www.oreilly.com/catalog/jextprockbk/chapter/ch04.pdf
> 
>   Id' say it is a must read kind of thing.

I wouldn't. I suspect they took material directly from the JUnit FAQ, 
based on similarity of examples and various turns of phrase. They 
certainly didn't seem to credit us when they did.

>   I do believe that overriding runTest() is a really ugly hack. It is
> really enough to override getName() method to make suite tests look
> different.

There's nothing ugly about it! If I don't want to use JUnit's "automatic 
test method extraction" feature, implementing runTest() myself is the 
simplest way to do it. Don't forget, back in the old days, that's how to 
set up /each and every test/!
